- coma or any neurological disorder

- evoked by capillary blood glucose, confirmed by blood glucose (blood glucose < 3 mmol/L)

- emergency resucration with direct IV glucose serum (G30% 1 ampoule) if consciousness is impaired

- orally, if you are conscious enough: sugar cubes, orange juice, etc.

- revaluation

question.title: What is the appropriate immediate treatment for hypoglycemia in adults and children?
question.description: A medical emergency requiring prompt action

option_a.title: Administering a glucagon injection
option_a.description: A treatment option for severe hypoglycemia

option_b.title: Oral administration of glucose tablets
option_b.description: A common treatment for mild hypoglycemia

option_c.title: Monitoring blood glucose levels only
option_c.description: A passive approach to managing hypoglycemia

option_d.title: IV administration of insulin
option_d.description: A treatment option for severe hypoglycemia
